112.01Â  Â  FRANCHISE GRANTED.
There is hereby granted to INTERSTATE POWER & LIGHT COMPANY, hereinafter
referred to as the "Company," its successors and assigns, the right, franchise
and privilege for the term of fifteen (15) years, subject to a limited right of
cancellation at the end of the fifth (5th) and tenth (10th) year anniversaries
of the anniversary date, from and after the passage, adoption, approval and
acceptance of the ordinance codified by this chapter, to lay down, maintain and
operate the necessary pipes, mains and other conductors and appliances in,
along and under the streets, avenues, alleys and public places in the City of
Clear Lake, Cerro Gordo County, Iowa as now or hereafter constituted, for the
purpose of distributing, supplying and selling gas to said City and the
residents thereof and to persons and corporations beyond the limits thereof;
also the right of eminent domain as provided in Section 364.2 of the Code of
Iowa.Â  The term "gas" as used in this franchise shall be construed to mean
natural gas only.
112.02Â  Â  MAINS AND PIPES.
The mains and pipes of the Company must be so placed as not to interfere
unnecessarily with water pipes, drains, sewers and fire plugs which have been
or may hereafter be placed in any street, alley and public places in said City
nor unnecessarily interfere with the proper use of the same, including ordinary
drainage, or with the sewers, underground pipe and other property of the City,
and the Company, its successors and assigns shall hold the City free and
harmless from all damages arising from the negligent acts or omissions of the
Company in the laying down, operation and maintenance of said natural gas
distribution system.
112.03Â  Â  EXCAVATIONS.
In making any excavations in any street, alley, avenue or public place,
Company, its successors and assigns, shall protect the site while work is in
progress by guards, barriers or signals, shall not unnecessarily obstruct the
use of the streets, shall back fill all openings in such manner as to prevent
settling or depressions in surface, and shall replace the surface, pavement or
sidewalk of such excavations with same materials, restoring the condition as
nearly as practical and if defects are caused shall repair the same.
112.04Â  Â  RELOCATION OF FACILITIES.
The Company shall, at its cost and expense, locate and relocate its existing
facilities or equipment in, on, over or under any public street or alley in the
City in such a manner as the City may at any time reasonably require for the
purposes of facilitating the construction, reconstruction, maintenance or
repair of the street or alley or any public improvement of, in or about any
such street or alley or reasonably promoting the efficient operation of any
such improvement.Â  If the City orders or requests the Company to relocate its
existing facilities or equipment for the primary benefit of a commercial or
private project, or as the result of the initial request of a commercial or
private developer or other non-public entity, the Company shall receive payment
for the cost of such relocation as a precondition to relocating its existing
facilities or equipment.Â  The City shall consider reasonable alternatives in
designing its public works projects so as not arbitrarily to cause the Company
unreasonable additional expense in exercising its authority under this
section.Â  The City shall also provide a reasonable alternative location for the
Company's facilities.Â  The City shall give the Company reasonable advance
written notice to vacate a public right-of-way.Â  Vacating a public right-of-way
shall not deprive the Company of its right to operate and maintain existing
facilities, until the reasonable cost of relocating the same are paid to the
Company.
112.05Â  SERVICE REQUIREMENTS.
Said Company, its successors and assigns, shall throughout the term of the
franchise distribute to all consumers gas of good quality and shall furnish
uninterrupted service, except as interruptible service may be specifically
contracted for with consumers; provided, however, that any prevention of
service caused by fire, act of God or unavoidable event or accident shall not
be a breach of this condition if the Company resumes service as quickly as is
reasonably practical after the happening of the act causing the interruption.
112.06Â  Â  METERING EQUIPMENT.
Company will install, own and maintain suitable metering equipment necessary
for measuring gas supplied to each customer in accordance with Company's
applicable rate schedule.Â  The customer shall supply a safe and proper place
for the installation of each such meter. Standards for meters and meter
practices shall be in accordance with regulations, rules or directives adopted
by the Iowa Utilities Board.
112.07Â  Â  EXTENSION OF SERVICE.
The Company shall extend its gas distribution system in accordance with rules
and regulations relating to customer connections and main and service line
extensions currently in effect and on file from time to time with the Iowa
Utilities Board.
112.08Â  Â  RATES AND CHARGES.
The Company shall supply gas to consumers within the City at just and
reasonable rates.Â  It is recognized that under the statutes of the State of
Iowa, the Iowa Utilities Board of the Iowa Department of Commerce is vested
with legal authority to supervise, fix or change rates and charges authorized
to be charged by the Company to gas consumers. In the event rates or charges in
general, or any class or type of rate or charge shall, during the term of this
franchise, cease to be regulated by any state or federal agency the City
Council reserves the right to regulate such rates within the City.
112.09Â  Â  PROVIDE INFORMATION TO CITY.
Upon reasonable request the Company shall provide the City, on a project
specific basis, information indicating the horizontal location, relative to
boundaries of the right of way, of all equipment which it owns or over which it
has control that is located in City right of way, including documents, maps and
other information in paper or electronic or other forms ("information"). The
Company does not guarantee the accuracy of the facility location contained in
the information and in no way does having this information relieve the City of
its obligation under Iowa law to call for locates.Â  The Company and City
recognize the information may in whole or part be considered a confidential
record under state or federal law or both. Therefore, the City shall not
release any information without prior consent of the Company and shall return
the information to Company upon request. City recognizes that Company claims
the information may constitute a trade secret or is otherwise protected from
public disclosure by state or federal law on other grounds and agrees to retain
the information in its non-public files. Furthermore, the City agrees that no
documents, maps or information provided to the City by the Company shall be
made available to the public or other entities if such documents or information
are exempt from disclosure under the provisions of the Freedom of Information
Act, the Federal Energy Regulatory Commission Critical Energy Infrastructure
requirements pursuant to 18 CFR 388.112 and 388.113, and Chapter 22 of the Code
of Iowa, as such statutes and regulations may be amended from time to time.
112.10Â  Â  NONEXCLUSIVE FRANCHISE.
The franchise granted by this chapter shall not be exclusive.
112.11Â  Â  FRANCHISE FEE.
In its monthly billing Company shall include a franchise fee of zero percent
(0%) on the gross receipts from the distribution, supply, or sale of natural
gas for customers within the limits of the City of Clear Lake, Cerro Gordo
County, Iowa.Â  The Company shall commence collecting the 0% franchise fee on
the date of January 1 or July 1, following six months from the date the
acceptance of this ordinance by the Company is filed with the City Clerk.Â  The
franchise fee may be increased or decreased by the City on or after July 1,
2010, and shall be limited to a maximum fee of 5%.Â  The Grantor shall give the
Company a minimum 6-month notice prior to the request to implement an increase
or decrease in the franchise fee.Â  Grantor shall be solely responsible for the
proper use of any amounts collected as franchise fees, and shall only use such
fees as collected for a purpose as allowed by applicable law. Collection of the
franchise fee shall cease at the earlier of the City's repeal of the franchise
fee or the end of the ordinance term.
112.12Â  Â  FRANCHISE FEE APPLICATION.
The franchise fee shall be applied to all customers' bills in accordance with
Iowa Code Chapter 364.2(f) and 423B.5.Â  The Company shall not grant exemptions
or refunds of the franchise fee beyond that granted by the Code of Iowa.Â  If at
any time the Iowa Utilities Board or another authority having proper
jurisdiction, prohibits the collection or payment of a franchise fee, the
Company shall be relieved of its obligation to collect and pay to the City the
franchise fee.
112.13Â  Â  FRANCHISE FEE OBLIGATIONS.
City agrees that Company's obligations related to the franchise fee are limited
to those obligations set forth in Sections 112.11 and 112.16 herein.Â  City
further agrees to bear all costs (including attorney fees), and to defend,
indemnify and hold Company harmless from any and all liability, claims or
causes of action associated with disputes related to the billing and/or
collection of the franchise fee, provided that the City shall not be obligated
to bear such costs or to defend, indemnify and hold Company harmless if such
disputes arise from claims of inaccurate billing by the Company.
112.14Â  Â  ANNEXATION.
Upon receipt of a final and unappealable order or approval authorizing
annexation, or changes in the limits of said City, the City Clerk shall provide
written notification to an officer of Company of such annexation or change in
the limits of said City, and the Company shall apply the franchise fee to its
customers who are affected by the annexation or change in the limits of the
City, commencing six (6) months from receipt of the written notice.
112.15Â  Â  FRANCHISE FEE BILLING.
The franchise fee charge related to Section 112.11 above shall be shown
separately on the utility bill to each customer.
112.16Â  Â  FRANCHISE FEES REMITTED TO CITY.
The Company shall remit collected franchise fees to the City on a quarterly
basis, within thirty (30) days after last day of the last revenue month of the
quarter.
112.17Â  Â  FRANCHISE FEE IN LIEU OF OTHER PAYMENTS.
That said franchise fee shall be in lieu of any other payments to the City for
the Company's use of streets, avenues, alleys and public places in the said
City and other administrative or regulatory costs with regard to said
franchise; and said pipes, mains, and other conductor and appliances in, along
and under the streets, avenues, alleys and public places in the said City for
the purpose of distributing, supplying and selling gas to said City and the
residents thereof and to persons and corporations beyond the limits thereof
shall be exempt from any special tax, assessment, license or rental charge
during the entire term of this ordinance.
112.18Â  Â  TERM OF FRANCHISE.
The term of the franchise granted by this ordinance and the rights granted
thereunder shall continue for the period of twenty-five (25) years from and
after its acceptance by the said Company, as herein provided. The City may
cancel this franchise on the fifth (5th) or tenth (10th) (15th) anniversary of
the anniversary date of this franchise by notifying Company in writing of its
desire to do so, said notification to be given within thirty (30) days of the
fifth (5th) or tenth (10th) anniversary of this franchise.Â  If Company is not
notified of the cancellation by the fifth (5th) or tenth (10th) anniversary
then this franchise shall continue without cancellation until the fifteenth
(15th) year.Â  The anniversary date shall be the date this franchise is filed
with the City Clerk or otherwise effective by operation of law.
112.19Â  Â  ANNUAL REPORT.
The Company shall on an annual basis present a brief report to the City
summarizing the Company's utility operations and activities within the City
during the previous twelve months.
112.20Â  Â  ACCEPTANCE BY COMPANY.
The franchise granted by this ordinance shall be conditioned upon acceptance by
the Company in writing.Â  The acceptance shall be filed with the City Clerk
within ninety (90) days from passage of this ordinance.
112.21Â  Â  ENTIRE AGREEMENT.
This ordinance sets forth and constitutes the entire agreement between the
Company and the City of Clear Lake with respect to the rights contained herein,
and may not be superseded, modified or otherwise amended without the approval
and acceptance of the Company.Â  Upon acceptance by the Company, this ordinance
shall supersede, abrogate and repeal the prior gas system ordinance between the
Company and the City of Clear Lake as of the date this ordinance is accepted by
the Company.Â  Notwithstanding the foregoing, in no event shall the City of
Clear Lake enact any ordinance or place any limitations, either operationally
or through the assessment of fees other than those approved and accepted by the
Company within this ordinance, that create additional burdens upon the Company,
or which delay utility operations.

115.06Â  VANDALISM IN CEMETERY.
Any person who destroys, injures or defaces any grave, vault, tombstone, or
monument, or any building, fence, tree, shrub, flower, or anything in or
belonging to any cemetery under the jurisdiction of the City shall be liable
for any and all damage, in addition to being subject to any other penalty
imposed.

120.01Â  LICENSE OR PERMIT REQUIRED.
No person shall manufacture for sale, import, sell, or offer or keep for sale,
alcoholic liquor, wine, or beer without first securing a liquor control
license, wine permit or beer permit in accordance with the provisions of
Chapter 123 of the Code of Iowa.
(Code of Iowa, Sec. 123.22, 123.122 & 123.171)
120.02Â  GENERAL PROHIBITION.
It is unlawful to manufacture for sale, sell, offer or keep for sale, possess
or transport alcoholic liquor, wine or beer except upon the terms, conditions,
limitations and restrictions enumerated in Chapter 123 of the Code of Iowa, and
a license or permit may be suspended or revoked or a civil penalty may be
imposed for a violation thereof.
(Code of Iowa, Sec. 123.2, 123.39 & 123.50)
120.03Â  INVESTIGATION.
Upon receipt of an application for a liquor license, wine or beer permit, the
Clerk may forward it to the Police Chief, who shall then conduct an
investigation and submit a written report as to the truth of the facts averred
in the application.Â  The Fire Chief may also inspect the premises to determine
if they conform to the requirements of the City.Â  The Council shall not approve
an application for a license or permit for any premises which does not conform
to the applicable law and ordinances, resolutions and regulations of the City.
(Code of Iowa, Sec. 123.30)
120.04Â  ACTION BY COUNCIL.
The Council shall either approve or disapprove the issuance of the liquor
control license or retail wine or beer permit and shall endorse its approval or
disapproval on the application, and thereafter the application, necessary fee
and bond, if required, shall be forwarded to the Alcoholic Beverages Division
of the State Department of Commerce for such further action as is provided by
law.
(Code of Iowa, Sec. 123.32 [2])
120.05Â  PROHIBITED SALES AND ACTS.
A person or club holding a liquor license or retail wine or beer permit and the
personâ€™s or clubâ€™s agents or employees shall not do any of the following:
1.Â Â Â Sell, dispense or give to any intoxicated person, or one simulating
intoxication, any alcoholic liquor, wine or beer.
(Code of Iowa, Sec. 123.49 [1])
2.Â Â Â Sell or dispense any alcoholic beverage, wine or beer on the premises
covered by the license or permit, or permit its consumption thereon between the
hours of two oâ€™clock (2:00) a.m. and six oâ€™clock (6:00) a.m.Â  on a weekday, and
between the hours of two oâ€™clock (2:00) a.m. on Sunday and six oâ€™clock (6:00)
a.m. on the following Monday; however, a holder of a license or permit granted

New Yearâ€™s Day and beer for consumption off the premises between the hours of
eight oâ€™clock (8:00) a.m. on Sunday and two oâ€™clock (2:00) a.m. on the
following Monday when that Sunday is the day before New Yearâ€™s Day.
(Code of Iowa, Sec. 123.49 [2b and 2k] & 123.150)
3.Â Â Â Sell alcoholic beverages, wine or beer to any person on credit, except
with bona fide credit card.Â  This provision does not apply to sales by a club
to its members nor to sales by a hotel or motel to bona fide registered guests.
(Code of Iowa, Sec. 123.49 [2c])
4.Â Â Â Employ a person under eighteen (18) years of age in the sale or serving of
alcoholic liquor, wine or beer for consumption on the premises where sold.
(Code of Iowa, Sec. 123.49 [2f])
5.Â Â Â In the case of a retail beer or wine permittee, knowingly allow the mixing
or adding of alcohol or any alcoholic beverage to beer, wine or any other
beverage in or about the permitteeâ€™s place of business.
(Code of Iowa, Sec. 123.49 [2i])
6.Â Â Â Knowingly permit any gambling, except in accordance with Iowa law, or
knowingly permit any solicitation for immoral purposes, or immoral or
disorderly conduct on the premises covered by the license or permit.
(Code of Iowa, Sec. 123.49 [2a])
7.Â Â Â Knowingly permit or engage in any criminal activity on the premises
covered by the license or permit.
(Code of Iowa, Sec. 123.49 [2j])
8.Â Â Â Keep on premises covered by a liquor control license any alcoholic liquor
in any container except the original package purchased from the Alcoholic
Beverages Division of the State Department of Commerce and except mixed drinks
or cocktails mixed on the premises for immediate consumption.
(Code of Iowa, Sec. 123.49 [2d])
9.Â Â Â Reuse for packaging alcoholic liquor or wine any container or receptacle

(Code of Iowa, Sec. 123.49 [2e])
10.Â Â Â Allow any person other than the licensee, permittee or employees of the

(Code of Iowa, Sec. 123.49 [2g])

121.01Â  DEFINITIONS.
For use in this chapter the following terms are defined:
(Code of Iowa, Sec. 453A.1)
1.Â Â Â â€œCartonâ€ means a box or container of any kind in which ten or more
packages or packs of cigarettes or tobacco products are offered for sale, sold
or otherwise distributed to consumers.
2.Â Â Â â€œCigaretteâ€ means any roll for smoking made wholly or in part of tobacco,
or any substitute for tobacco, irrespective of size or shape and irrespective
of tobacco or any substitute for tobacco being flavored, adulterated or mixed
with any other ingredient, where such roll has a wrapper or cover made of paper
or any other material.Â  However, this definition is not to be construed to
include cigars.
3.Â Â Â â€œPackageâ€ or â€œpackâ€ means a container of any kind in which cigarettes or
tobacco products are offered for sale, sold or otherwise distributed to
consumers.
4.Â Â Â â€œPlace of businessâ€ means any place where cigarettes are sold, stored or
kept for the purpose of sale or consumption by a retailer.
5.Â Â Â â€œRetailerâ€ means every person who sells, distributes or offers for sale
for consumption, or possesses for the purpose of sale for consumption,
cigarettes, irrespective of the quantity or amount or the number of sales.
6.Â Â Â â€œSelf-service displayâ€ means any manner of product display, placement or
storage from which a person purchasing the product may take possession of the
product, prior to purchase, without assistance from the retailer or employee of
the retailer, in removing the product from a restricted access location.
7.Â Â Â â€œTobacco productsâ€ means the following:Â  cigars; little cigars; cheroots;
stogies; periques; granulated, plug cut, crimp cut, ready rubbed and other
smoking tobacco; snuff; snuff flour; cavendish; plug and twist tobacco; fine-
cut and other chewing tobaccos; shorts or refuse scraps, clippings, cuttings
and sweepings of tobacco; and other kinds and forms of tobacco prepared in such
manner as to be suitable for chewing or smoking in a pipe or otherwise, or for
both chewing and smoking, but does not mean cigarettes.
121.02Â  PERMIT REQUIRED.
It is unlawful for any person, other than a holder of a retail permit, to sell
cigarettes at retail and no retailer shall distribute, sell or solicit the sale
of any cigarettes within the City without a valid permit for each place of

(Code of Iowa, Sec. 453A.13)

121.07Â  PERSONS UNDER LEGAL AGE.
No person shall sell, give or otherwise supply any tobacco, tobacco products or
cigarettes to any person under eighteen (18) years of age.Â  The provision of
this section includes prohibiting a minor from purchasing cigarettes or tobacco
products from a vending machine.Â  If a retailer or employee of a retailer
violates the provisions of this section, the Council shall, after written
notice and hearing, and in addition to the other penalties fixed for such
violation, assess the following:
1.Â Â Â For a first violation, the retailer shall be assessed a civil penalty in
the amount of three hundred dollars ($300.00).Â  Failure to pay the civil
penalty as ordered under this subsection shall result in automatic suspension
of the permit for a period of fourteen (14) days.
2.Â Â Â For a second violation within a period of two (2) years, the retailer
shall be assessed a civil penalty in the amount of one thousand five hundred
dollars ($1,500.00) or the retailer's permit shall be suspended for a period of
thirty (30) days.Â  The retailer may select its preference in the penalty to be
applied under this subsection.
3.Â Â Â For a third violation within a period of three (3) years, the retailer
shall be assessed a civil penalty in the amount of one thousand five hundred
dollars ($1,500.00) and the retailer's permit shall be suspended for a period
of thirty (30) days.
4.Â Â Â For a fourth violation within a period of three (3) years, the retailer
shall be assessed a civil penalty in the amount of one thousand five hundred
dollars ($1,500.00) and the retailer's permit shall be suspended for a period
of sixty (60) days.
5.Â Â Â For a fifth violation within a period of four (4) years, the retailer's
permit shall be revoked.
The Clerk shall give ten (10) days' written notice to the retailer by mailing a
copy of the notice to the place of business as it appears on the application
for a permit.Â  The notice shall state the reason for the contemplated action
and the time and place at which the retailer may appear and be heard.
(Code of Iowa, Sec. 453A.2, 453A.22Â  and 453A.36[6])
121.08Â  SELF-SERVICE SALES PROHIBITED.

121.09Â  PERMIT REVOCATION.

122.01Â  PURPOSE.
The purpose of this chapter is to protect residents of the City against fraud,
unfair competition and intrusion into the privacy of their homes by licensing
and regulating peddlers, solicitors and transient merchants.
122.02Â  DEFINITIONS.
For use in this chapter the following terms are defined:
1.Â Â Â â€œPeddlerâ€ means any person carrying goods or merchandise who sells or
offers for sale for immediate delivery such goods or merchandise from house to
house or upon the public street.
2.Â Â Â â€œSolicitorâ€ means any person who solicits or attempts to solicit from
house to house or upon the public street any contribution or donation or any

future date.
3.Â Â Â â€œTransient merchantâ€ means any person who engages in a temporary or
itinerant merchandising business and in the course of such businessÂ  hires,
leases or occupies any building or structure whatsoever, or who operates out of
a vehicle which is parked anywhere within the City limits.Â  Temporary
association with a local merchant, dealer, trader or auctioneer, or conduct of
such transient business in connection with, as a part of, or in the name of any
local merchant, dealer, trader or auctioneer does not exempt any person from
being considered a transient merchant.
122.03Â  LICENSE REQUIRED.

122.11Â  REVOCATION OF LICENSE.

chapter for the following reasons:
1.Â Â Â Fraudulent Statements.Â  The licensee has made fraudulent statements in the
application for the license or in the conduct of the business.
2.Â Â Â Violation of Law.Â  The licensee has violated this chapter or has otherwise
conducted the business in an unlawful manner.
3.Â Â Â Endangered Public Welfare, Health or Safety.Â  The licensee has conducted
the business in such manner as to endanger the public welfare, safety, order or
morals.
122.12Â  NOTICE.
The Clerk shall send a notice to the licensee at the licenseeâ€™s local address,
not less than ten (10) days before the date set for a hearing on the possible
revocation of a license.Â  Such notice shall contain particulars of the
complaints against the licensee, the ordinance provisions or State statutes
allegedly violated, and the date, time and place for hearing on the matter.
122.13Â  HEARING.
The Clerk shall conduct a hearing at which both the licensee and any
complainants shall be present to determine the truth of the facts alleged in
the complaint and notice.Â  Should the licensee, or authorized representative,
fail to appear without good cause, the Clerk may proceed to a determination of
the complaint.
122.14Â  RECORD AND DETERMINATION.
The Clerk shall make and record findings of fact and conclusions of law, and
shall revoke a license only when upon review of the entire record the Clerk
finds clear and convincing evidence of substantial violation of this chapter or
State law.
122.15Â  APPEAL.
If the Clerk revokes or refuses to issue a license, the Clerk shall make a part
of the record the reasons therefor.Â  The licensee, or the applicant, shall have
a right to a hearing before the Council at its next regular meeting.Â  The
Council may reverse, modify or affirm the decision of the Clerk by a majority
vote of the Council members present and the Clerk shall carry out the decision
of the Council.
122.16Â  EFFECT OF REVOCATION.
Revocation of any license shall bar the licensee from being eligible for any
license under this chapter for a period of one year from the date of the
revocation.
122.17Â  REBATES.
There shall be no rebate or refund of license fees because of surrender or
revocation of a license before expiration of the full period for which is was
issued.
122.18Â  LICENSE EXEMPTIONS.
The following are excluded from the application of this chapter.
1.Â Â Â Newspapers.Â  Persons delivering, collecting for or selling subscriptions
to newspapers.
2.Â Â Â Club Members. Members of local civic and service clubs, Boy Scout, Girl
Scout, 4-H Clubs, Future Farmers of America and similar organizations.
3.Â Â Â Local Residents and Farmers.Â  Local residents and farmers who offer for
sale their own products.
4.Â Â Â Students.Â  Students representing the Clear Lake School District or Ventura
School District conducting projects sponsored by organizations recognized by
the school.
5.Â Â Â Route Sales.Â  Route delivery persons who only incidentally solicit
additional business or make special sales.
6.Â Â Â Resale or Institutional Use.Â  Persons customarily calling on businesses or
institutions for the purposes of selling products for resale or institutional
use.
7.Â Â Â Government.Â  Officers or employees of the City, the Clear Lake Public
Library, the Clear Lake Community School District, County, State or Federal
government or any subdivision thereof, when on official business.
8.Â Â Â Religious and Charitable.Â  Bona fide charitable or religious
organizations.
9.Â Â Â Civic Clubs.Â  Solicitors on behalf of any service club or chamber of
commerce, including regularly scheduled community festivals or promotions
involving temporary sidewalk displays.
10.Â Â Â Arts and Crafts.Â  Persons selling creations of art or craft, whether
paintings, drawings, photographs, pottery, other goods or similar works of art,
provided that such creations may be sold only by the creating artist and only
in locations not otherwise prohibited by ordinance.
122.19Â  CHARITABLE AND NONPROFIT ORGANIZATIONS.
Authorized representatives of charitable or nonprofit organizations operating
under the provisions of Chapter 504A of the Code of Iowa desiring to solicit
money or to distribute literature are exempt from the operation of Sections
122.04 and 122.05.Â  All such organizations are required to submit in writing to
the Clerk the name and purpose of the cause for which such activities are
sought, names and addresses of the officers and directors of the organization,
the period during which such activities are to be carried on, and whether any
commissions, fees or wages are to be charged by the solicitor and the amount
thereof.Â  If the Clerk finds that the organization is a bona fide charity or
nonprofit organization the Clerk shall issue, free of charge, a license
containing the above information to the applicant.Â  In the event the Clerk
denies the exemption, the authorized representatives of the organization may
appeal the decision to the Council, as provided in Section 122.15 of this
chapter.

123.01Â  HOUSE MOVER DEFINED.
A â€œhouse moverâ€ means any person who undertakes to move a building or similar
structure upon, over or across public streets or property when the building or
structure is of such size that it requires the use of skids, jacks, dollies or
any other specialized moving equipment.
123.02Â  PERMIT REQUIRED.
It is unlawful for any person to engage in the activity of house mover as
herein defined without a valid permit from the City for each house, building or
similar structure to be moved.Â  Buildings of less than one hundred (100) square
feet are exempt from the provisions of this chapter.
123.03Â  APPLICATION.
Application for a house moverâ€™s permit shall be made in writing to the Clerk.Â 
The application shall include:
1.Â Â Â Name and Address.Â  The applicantâ€™s full name and address and if a
corporation the names and addresses of its principal officers.
2.Â Â Â Building Location.Â  An accurate description of the present location and
future site of the building or similar structure to be moved.
3.Â Â Â Routing Plan.Â  A routing plan approved by the Police Chief, Public Works
Director, and utility officials.Â  The route approved shall be the shortest
route compatible with the greatest public convenience and safety.
123.04Â  BOND REQUIRED.
The applicant shall post with the Clerk a penal bond in the minimum sum of five
thousand dollars ($5,000.00) issued by a surety company authorized to issue
such bonds in the State.Â  The bond shall guarantee the permitteeâ€™s payment for
any damage done to the City or to public property, and payment of all costs
incurred by the City in the course of moving the building or structure.
123.05Â  INSURANCE REQUIRED.
Each applicant shall also file a certificate of insurance indicating that the
applicant is carrying public liability insurance in effect for the duration of
the permit covering the applicant and all agents and employees for the
following minimum amounts:
1.Â Â Â Bodily Injury - $250,000 per person; $500,000 per accident.
2.Â Â Â Property Damage - $100,000 per accident.
123.06Â  PERMIT FEE.
A permit fee of fifty dollars ($50.00) shall be payable at the time of filing
the application with the Clerk.Â  A separate permit shall be required for each
house, building or similar structure to be moved.
123.07Â  PERMIT ISSUED.
Upon approval of the application, filing of bond and insurance certificate, and
payment of the required fee, the Clerk shall issue a permit.
123.08Â  PUBLIC SAFETY.
At all times when a building or similar structure is in motion upon any street,
alley, sidewalk or public property, the permittee shall maintain flagmen at the
closest intersections or other possible channels of traffic to the sides,
behind and ahead of the building or structure.Â  At all times when the building
or structure is at rest upon any street, alley, sidewalk or public property the
permittee shall maintain adequate warning signs or lights at the intersections
or channels of traffic to the sides, behind and ahead of the building or
structure.
123.09Â  TIME LIMIT.
No house mover shall permit or allow a building or similar structure to remain
upon any street or other public way for a period of more than twelve (12) hours
without having first secured the written approval of the City.
123.10Â  REMOVAL BY CITY.
In the event any building or similar structure is found to be in violation of
Section 123.09 the City is authorized to remove such building or structure and
assess the costs thereof against the permit holder and the surety on the permit
holderâ€™s bond.
123.11Â  PROTECT PAVEMENT.
It is unlawful to move any house or building of any kind over any pavement,
unless the wheels or rollers upon which the house or building is moved are at
least one (1) inch in width for each one thousand (1,000) pounds of weight of
such building.Â  If there is any question as to the weight of a house or
building, the estimate of the City as to such weight shall be final.
123.12Â  OVERHEAD WIRES.
The holder of any permit to move a building shall see that all telephone, cable
television and electric wires and poles are removed when necessary and replaced
in good order, and shall be liable for the costs of the same.
CHAPTER 124
HOTEL/MOTEL TAX
Â 
124.01Â  Tax Imposed124.03Â  Collection
124.02Â  Definition 124.04Â  Restrictions on Use of Revenues
Â 
124.01Â  TAX IMPOSED.
There is imposed a seven percent (7%) hotel and motel tax upon the gross
receipts from the renting of sleeping rooms, apartments or sleeping quarters in
a hotel, motel, inn, public lodging house, rooming house, mobile home which is
tangible personal property, or tourist court or in any place where sleeping
accommodations are furnished to transient guests for rent, whether with or
without meals.
(Code of Iowa, Sec. 422A.1)
124.02Â  DEFINITION.
â€œRentingâ€ and â€œrent,â€ as used in this chapter, include any kind of direct or
indirect charge for the use of sleeping rooms, apartments or sleeping
quarters.Â  However, the tax imposed in this chapter does not apply to the gross
receipts from the renting of a room, apartment or sleeping quarters while
rented by the same person for a period of more than thirty-one (31) consecutive
days.
(Code of Iowa, Sec. 422A.1)
124.03Â  COLLECTION.
The tax imposed in this chapter shall be remitted by the person or company
liable for same to the Iowa State Director of Revenue in the manner required by
State law.
(Code of Iowa, Sec. 422A.1)
124.04Â  RESTRICTIONS ON USE OF REVENUES.
The revenue derived from the tax imposed by this chapter shall be accounted for
as follows:
1.Â Â Â All revenue received by the City from the imposition of the hotel and
motel tax shall be deposited in the General Fund of the City.
2.Â Â Â At least fifty percent (50%) of the revenue derived from the hotel and
motel tax shall be spent for the acquisition of sites for, or constructing,
improving, enlarging, equipping, repairing, operating or maintaining
recreational, convention, cultural or entertainment facilities, including, but
not limited to, memorial buildings, halls and monuments, civic centers,
convention buildings, auditoriums, coliseums and parking areas or facilities
located at those recreational, convention, cultural or entertainment
facilities, or the payment of principal and interest on bonds or other evidence
of indebtedness issued by the City for those recreational, convention, cultural
or entertainment facilities, or for the promotion and encouragement of tourist
and convention business in the City and surrounding areas.
3.Â Â Â The remaining revenues may be spent by the City for any lawful purpose for
which revenues derived from ad valorem taxes may be expended.
4.Â Â Â The revenue generated from the increase in the tax rate from 5% to 7%
shall be applied as follows:
Â Â Â A.Â Â Â 1.5% of said rate increase to fund the City's financial commitment to
the Lake Dredging & Restoration Project and other lake improvement initiatives
thereafter; and
Â Â Â B.Â Â Â 0.5% of said rate increase to fund the maintenance of permanently
located recreational, cultural or entertainment facilities that are available
to the general public within the City.

128.01Â  DEFINITIONS.
For use in this chapter, the following terms are defined:
1.Â Â Â â€œOpen to the publicâ€ means a place in which a public amusement is

that the general public is not free to enter and to which admission is
restricted to members of a nonprofit charitable corporation or association,
fraternal organization, or religious or educational group, and does not include
places where admission is limited by reason of age or sex.
2.Â Â Â "Public amusement" means and includes any public dance hall; billiard or
pool hall; bowling alley; amusement park or rides; maze; theater; rides, which
includes methods and equipment used to transport persons for hire not otherwise
defined as a taxi and including, but not limited to, jitneys, vans, horses, and

3.Â Â Â â€œPublic dance hallâ€ means any place of public amusement in which dancing
is engaged in or performed, whether or not food is served and the operator

4.Â Â Â â€œTheaterâ€ means any place of public amusement in which plays, motion

128.02Â  LICENSE REQUIRED.

3.Â Â Â If the applicant or owner is a corporation or other association, the names

128.04Â  INSPECTION AND INVESTIGATION.

128.05Â  ISSUANCE OF LICENSE.

hall unless the above requirements are satisfied.Â  No minor, however, shall be
allowed in any billiard or pool hall in which beer is sold.

128.08Â  REVOCATION OF LICENSE.
After five daysâ€™ notice and a hearing, the Clerk may revoke any license issued
under this chapter for the following reasons:
1.Â Â Â The licensee has made fraudulent statements in the application for the
license or in the conduct of the business.
2.Â Â Â The licensee has substantially violated this chapter or has otherwise
conducted the business in an unlawful manner.
3.Â Â Â The licensee has conducted the business in such manner as to endanger
substantially the public welfare, health, safety, order or morals.
The notice shall be in writing and shall be served personally or as required
for personal service by the Iowa Rules of Civil Procedure.Â  The notice shall
state the time and place of the hearing and the reasons for the intended
revocation.
128.09Â  REVOCATION APPEAL TO COUNCIL.
If the Clerk revokes a license, the Clerk shall notify the Council in writing
immediately, giving the reasons for the revocation.Â  The licensee shall then
have a right to a hearing before the Council at its next regular or special
meeting.Â  The Council may reverse, modify or affirm the decision of the Clerk.
128.10Â  EFFECT OF REVOCATION.
Revocation of any license shall bar the licensee from being eligible for any
license under this chapter for a period of one year from the date of the
revocation.
128.11Â  LICENSE NOT TRANSFERABLE.
In no case shall a license issued under this chapter be transferred to another
person or be used for a purpose other than that for which it was issued.
128.12Â  DISPLAY OF LICENSE.
Every person who is issued a license under the provisions of this chapter shall
display the license in a conspicuous place on the premises on which the
business is being conducted.
128.13Â  REBATES.
There shall be no rebate or refund of license fees because of surrender or
revocation of a license before expiration of the full period for which is was
issued.
CHAPTER 129
TAXICAB POLICY
129.01  Definitions              129.09Â  Displaying License and Rates
129.02Â  License Required        129.10Â  Term of License

129.01Â  DEFINITIONS.
For use in this chapter, the following terms are defined:
1.Â Â Â "Driver" means any person who drives or otherwise operates a taxicab.
2.Â Â Â "Operator" means any person, whether or not the owner of a taxi that will
profit financially by the operation of a taxi, but does not include a person
hired to drive a taxi.
3.Â Â Â "Taxi" means any motor vehicle that is used on the streets of the City for
the purpose of carrying passengers for hire, and which follows no regular route
or time schedule, except those designated to carry more than seven (7) persons.
129.02Â  LICENSE REQUIRED.
It is unlawful for any person to operate a taxi without a valid taxi license.
129.03Â  LICENSE APPLICATION.
A taxi operator shall apply in writing to the City Clerk for a license for each
taxi.Â  The application shall include the name, residential and business
addresses of the operator and the make, model, year of manufacture, motor
number and State license plate number of each taxi.
129.04Â  FEE.
The application for a license shall be accompanied by a license fee of $20.00
for each vehicle to be licensed.
129.05Â  INVESTIGATION AND REPORT.
Before the issuance of the license, the Police Chief or designee shall
investigate the character of the applicant and any potential driver.Â  The Chief
of Police shall inspect the taxis to be licensed for possible violations of the
State motor vehicle law and shall report on these matters to the Clerk.
129.06Â  LIABILITY INSURANCE.
Before beginning the operation of any taxi business, the operator shall file
with the Clerk a certificate of insurance indicating minimum limits of $100,000
for a single personal injury or death, $300,000 for multiple injuries or
deaths, and $50,000 for property damage.
129.07Â  ISSUANCE.
The Clerk shall promptly review each application and shall issue a license if
he/she finds that such issuance will be consistent with the public convenience,
safety, health and welfare.
129.08Â  LICENSE CONTENTS.
A license shall contain the signatures of the City Administrator and Clerk, the
date of issuance, the period for which the license is valid and the information
contained in the application.
129.09Â  DISPLAYING LICENSE AND RATES.
Operators shall display within the taxi, in full view of passengers, the taxi
license, schedule of rates, and the name of the driver.
129.10Â  TERM OF LICENSE.
All taxi licenses issued shall be valid for one year and shall expire on March
31 of each year.Â  The fee paid shall be nonrefundable and not pro-rated for
revocation, suspension or for operation for a portion of a licensed period.
129.11Â  LICENSES NOT TRANSFERABLE.
Each taxi license shall be issued for one specific taxi only and shall not be
transferable from taxi to taxi or to a different operator.Â  The operator shall
notify the Clerk when a licensed taxi is withdrawn from service to be replaced
by another taxi, at which time the Clerk, subject to the City Administrator's
approval, shall allow the transfer of the license subject to compliance with
the vehicle inspection requirements set out herein.
129.12Â  REVOCATION OF LICENSE.
The Council may revoke or suspend any license issued herein for the following
reasons:
1.Â Â Â Fraudulent Statements.Â  The operator has made fraudulent statements in the
application for the license or in the conduct of business.
2.Â Â Â Violation of Law or Ordinance.Â  The operator has substantially violated
the requirements of this policy or the State motor vehicle laws.
3.Â Â Â Operation as to Endanger Safety, Health or Welfare.Â  The operator has
conducted business in a manner that substantially endangers the public safety,
health, welfare, order or morals.
The Council shall conduct a hearing before revoking or suspending a license.Â 
The operator shall be given notice of the hearing at least five (5) and not
more than thirty (30) days before the date of the hearing.Â  The notice shall be
in writing and shall be served personally or as required for personal service
by the Iowa Court Rules.Â  The notice shall state the time and place of the
hearing and the reasons for the intended revocation or suspension.
129.13Â  SUPERVISION.
The Police Department has the power at any time to investigate the conduct of
any taxi business and the operation of the licensed taxis, and to inspect the
licensed taxis for possible violations of the State motor vehicle law and shall
report on these matters to the Council.Â  The Police Department shall inspect
all taxis at least once a year.
129.14Â  DUTY TO CARRY.
No driver shall refuse or neglect to convey any orderly person upon request,
unless previously engaged, or unless the driver is unable or forbidden to do so
by the provisions of this policy.
129.15Â  QUALIFICATIONS.
Every driver of a licensed taxi shall be at least eighteen (18) years of age
and shall possess a valid State chauffeur's license.
129.16Â  SOLICITING BUSINESS.
Taxi drivers shall not stop, park or drive about the City streets or public
places to solicit passengers by words, signs or signals, but they may take on
passengers anywhere in the City at the passenger's request, or at designated
taxi stands.
CHAPTER 130
ADULT ENTERTAINMENT
Â 
130.01Â  Purpose              130.08Â  Touching of Entertainers
130.02Â  Definitions          130.09Â  Exemption

130.01Â  PURPOSE.
The purpose of this chapter is to regulate adult entertainment businesses to
promote the health, safety, morals and general welfare of the citizens of the
City and to establish reasonable and uniform regulations to prevent the
continued deleterious location and concentration of adult entertainment
businesses within the City.Â  It is not the intent of this chapter to suppress
any activities protected by the First Amendment, but to enact content neutral
regulations that address the secondary effects of adult entertainment
establishments, as well as the health problems associated with such
establishments.
130.02Â  DEFINITIONS.
As used in this chapter, unless the context otherwise requires, the following
words and terms shall have the meanings which are ascribed to them herein, as
follows:
1.Â Â Â "Adult book store" means an establishment with a significant portion of
its stock in trade consisting of books, films, magazines and other periodicals
which are distinguished or characterized by an emphasis on the depiction or
description of sex acts or specified anatomical areas, as defined in herein.
2.Â Â Â "Adult entertainment" means an amusement or entertainment which is
distinguished or characterized by an emphasis on acts or material depicting,
describing or relating to specified sexual activities or specified anatomical
areas, including, but not limited to, topless or bottomless dancers, exotic
dancers, strippers, male or female impersonators or similar entertainment.
3.Â Â Â "Adult entertainment business" shall include, but not be limited to the
following: adult bookstores, adult motels, adult motion picture arcades and
theaters, massage parlors, sexual encounter centers, and restaurants, bars, or
taverns (featuring live dancing or entertainment, such as go-go dancing, strip-
tease acts, and exotic dancing), or like facilities, which feature or are
distinguished or characterized by an emphasis on any actual or simulated
specified "sex acts" or "specified anatomical areas" as defined herein.
4.Â Â Â "Adult motel" means a motel wherein material is presented which is
distinguished or characterized by an emphasis on the depiction or description
of sex acts or specified anatomical areas, as defined herein.
5.Â Â Â "Adult motion picture arcade" means any place to which the public is
permitted or invited wherein coin or slug-operated or electronically,
electrically or mechanically controlled still or motion picture machines,
projectors or other image-producing devices are maintained to show images to
five or fewer persons per machine at any one time, and where the images so
displayed are distinguished or characterized by an emphasis on the depiction or
description of sex acts or specified anatomical areas, as defined herein.
6.Â Â Â "Adult motion picture theater" means an enclosed building used for
presenting material distinguished or characterized by an emphasis on the
depiction or description of sex acts or specified anatomical areas as defined
herein.
7.Â Â Â "Adult nightclub" means any club, cabaret, night club, bar, restaurant, or
similar establishment where an enclosed building or open air facility is used
for live performance, which is characterized by the exposure of specified
sexual activities and specified anatomical areas for observation by persons
therein.
8.Â Â Â "Establishment of an adult entertainment business" means the opening of
such business as a new business, the relocation of such business or the
conversion of an existing business to an adult entertainment business.
9.Â Â Â "Fondle" or "Caress" means to bring any part of the body into contact with
the body of another, in a sportive or affectionate manner, for the purpose of
producing or experiencing sexual arousal or excitement.
10.Â Â Â "Massage parlor" means any place where, for any form of consideration or
gratuity, massage, alcohol rubs, administration of fomentations, electric or
magnetic treatments or any other treatment or manipulation of the human body
occurs as part of or in connection with sex acts or where any person providing
such treatment, manipulation or service related thereto exposes specified
anatomical areas.
11.Â Â Â "Person of good moral character" means any person who meets all of the
following requirements:
Â Â Â A.Â Â Â Has such financial standing and a reputation that will satisfy the
Council that he or she will comply with this chapter and all laws, ordinances
and regulations applicable to operation of an adult entertainment business.
Â Â Â B.Â Â Â Is a citizen of the United States and a resident of Iowa or, in the
case of a corporation, licensed to do business in Iowa.
Â Â Â C.Â Â Â Has not been convicted of a felony.Â  However, if this conviction of a
felony occurred more than five (5) years before the date of the application for
a permit, and if the Governor has restored the applicant's rights of
citizenship, the Council may determine that such person is a person of good
moral character notwithstanding such conviction.
If the person is a corporation, partnership, association, club, hotel or motel,
the foregoing requirements of this subsection shall apply to each officer,
director, partner or associate who, directly or indirectly, owns or controls
ten percent (10%) or more of any class of stock of such organization or has an
interest of ten percent (10%) or more in the ownership or profits of such
organization.Â  For the purpose of this provision, an individual and spouse
shall be regarded as one person.
12.Â Â Â "Sex acts" means any sexual contact, actual or simulated, either natural
or deviate, between two or more persons, or between a person and an animal, by
the penetration of the penis into the vagina or anus or by contact between the
mouth or tongue and genitalia or anus, or by contact between a finger of one
person and the genitalia of another person or by use of artificial sexual
organs in contact with the genitalia or anus.
13.Â Â Â "Sexual encounter center" means any business, agency or persons who, for
any form of consideration or gratuity, provide a place where three or more
persons, not all of whom are members of the same family, may congregate,
assemble or associate for the purpose of engaging in sex acts or exposing
specified anatomical areas, as defined herein.
14.Â Â Â "Specified anatomical areas" includes human genitals, pubic region,
buttocks and female breasts below a point immediately above the top of the
areola.
130.03Â  PERMIT REQUIRED.
1.Â Â Â Any person desiring to obtain a permit or renew an existing permit to
operate an adult entertainment business shall make application to the Clerk.Â 
Prior to submitting such application for a permit or renewal, a nonrefundable
fee of one thousand dollars ($1,000.00) shall be paid to the Clerk to defray
the cost of the investigation and report required by this chapter.Â  The Clerk
shall issue a receipt showing that such application or renewal fee has been
paid.Â  Permit issuance or renewal fees required under this chapter are in
addition to any license, permit or fee required under any other chapter of this
Code of Ordinances.
2.Â Â Â In the event the applicant is not the owner of record of the real property
upon which the adult entertainment business is or is to be located, the
application must be accompanied by a notarized statement from the owner of
record of the property acknowledging that an adult entertainment business is or
will be located on the property.Â  In addition to furnishing such notarized
statement, the applicant shall furnish the name and address of the owner of
record of the property, as well as a copy of the lease or rental agreement
pertaining to the premises in which the adult entertainment business is or will
be located.
3.Â Â Â The fact that a person possesses other types of state or City permits and/
or licenses does not exempt such person from the requirement of obtaining an
adult entertainment business permit.
130.04Â  APPLICATION PROCEDURE.
Any person seeking a permit to operate an adult entertainment business shall
make application to the City Clerk.Â  The Clerk shall cause an investigation of
such application to be made by the appropriate police authority to determine if
the applicant is of good moral character.Â  The Clerk shall also cause an
investigation to be made by the Fire Department and appropriate City
departments to determine that all requirements of this chapter have been
satisfied and the applicant has fully complied with all applicable ordinances
and regulations relating to the buildings, zoning, fire and health.Â  The
application shall contain the following:
1.Â Â Â Personal.Â  The full name, address, and social security number of the
applicant.Â 
2.Â Â Â Business Information.Â  The full name of the business and the address of
the premises for which the application is being made.
3.Â Â Â Criminal Record.Â  The criminal record of the applicant, if any.
4.Â Â Â Statement of Truth.Â  A statement that the contents of the application are
true.
5.Â Â Â Age.Â  Proof that the applicant is an adult.
6.Â Â Â Type of Business.Â  The type of business entity such as sole
proprietorship, partnership, limited liability company or corporation and, in
the case of any legal entity, the names and addresses for all the officers,
managers, and/or directors of the entity as the case may be.
7.Â Â Â Background of Management.Â  All information required herein of any
applicant shall also be provided for every person who, directly or indirectly,
has any right to participate in the management, control, or oversight of the
business to be conducted at the premises of the proposed adult entertainment
business.Â  In addition, the applicant shall outline information about any
previous or current adult entertainment businesses operated by the applicant.
8.Â Â Â Owner of the Building.Â  The name and address of the owner of the building
where the adult entertainment business will be located.Â 
9.Â Â Â Copies of the Lease or Rental Agreement.Â  A certified copy of any lease or
rental agreement governing the applicants' rights in the premises shall be
attached to the application.
10.Â Â Â Signatures.Â  The signatures of the applicant or applicants. If the
application is in the name of a corporation, the signature of each officer,
manager and/or director is required on the application.
130.05Â  ISSUANCE OF PERMIT.
The applicable City departments (i.e. building, fire and police departments)
shall make a written report of their investigations and shall submit such
reports to the City Clerk within forty-five (45) days of the date of
application.Â  The Clerk shall place the matter before the Council.Â  If the
Council finds that the applicant has fully complied with all the requirements
of this chapter and all applicable ordinances and codes regulating fire,
building, health and zoning, and the applicant is of good moral character, the
Council shall authorize the issuance of a permit to conduct an adult
entertainment business at the location designated in the application.Â  Said
permit shall expire one (1) year from the date of issuance.
130.06Â  LOCATION RESTRICTIONS.
No permit shall be issued for the establishment of an adult entertainment
business within 2,000 feet of another such business, a church, a school, a
public park, a public plaza, a public playground, a property zoned or used for
residential purposes.Â  For the purpose of this section, measurement shall be
made in a straight line, without regard to intervening structures or objects,
from the nearest portion of the building or structure used as a part of the
premises where an adult entertainment business is conducted, to the nearest
property line of the premises of a church or public or private elementary or
secondary school, or to the nearest boundary of an affected public park, or
property designated for residential use or used for residential purposes.
130.07Â  PROHIBITED ACTS.
An adult entertainment business shall conform to Iowa Code 2003, Section 728.5:
Â  Public Indecent Exposure In Certain Establishments.Â  An owner, manager, or
person who exercises direct control over a place of business required to obtain
a sales tax permit shall be guilty of a serious misdemeanor under any of the
following circumstances:
1.Â Â Â If such person allows or permits the actual or simulated public
performance of any sex act upon or in such place of business.
2.Â Â Â If such person allows or permits the exposure of the genitals or buttocks
or female breast of any person who acts as a waiter or waitress.
3.Â Â Â If such person allows or permits the exposure of the genitals or female
breast nipple of any person who acts as an entertainer, whether or not the
owner of the place of business in which the activity is performed employs or
pays any compensation to such person to perform such activity.
4.Â Â Â If such person allows or permits any person to remain in or upon the place
of business who exposes to public view the person's genitals, pubic hair, or
anus.
5.Â Â Â If such person advertises that any activity prohibited by this section is
allowed or permitted in such place of business.
6.Â Â Â If such person allows or permits a minor to engage in or otherwise perform
in a live act intended to arouse or satisfy the sexual desires or appeal to the
prurient interests of patrons.Â  However, if such person allows or permits a
minor to participate in any act included in subsections 1 through 4, the person
shall be guilty of an aggravated misdemeanor.
130.08Â  TOUCHING OF ENTERTAINERS.
1.Â Â Â No person appearing as an entertainer on premises of an "adult
entertainment business" within the meaning of this chapter shall fondle, caress
or sit on the lap of any customer on said premises if the entertainer presents
a performance on the premises while in attire as to leave exposed the
entertainer's genitals, or pubic hair, or anus, or buttocks, or female breast,
or female breast with only the nipple covered.
2.Â Â Â No person present as a customer on premises of an "adult entertainment
business" within the meaning of this chapter shall fondle, caress or sit on the
lap of any entertainer on said premises if the entertainer presents a
performance on the premises in attire as to leave exposed the entertainer's
genitals, or pubic hair, or anus, or buttocks, or female breast, or female
breast with only the nipple covered.
3.Â Â Â Any person in violation of this section shall be guilty of a simple
misdemeanor.
130.09Â  EXEMPTION.
The provisions of this chapter shall not apply to a theater, concert hall, art
center, museum, or similar establishment which is primarily devoted to the arts
or theatrical performances and in which any of the circumstances contained in
this chapter were permitted or allowed as part of such art exhibits or
performances.
130.10Â  MINORS.
It is unlawful to allow a person who is younger than eighteen (18) years of age
to enter or be on the premises of an adult entertainment business at any time
that the establishment is open for business. The operator must ensure that an
attendant is stationed at each public entrance at all times during regular
business hours. The attendant shall prohibit any person under the age of
eighteen (18) from entering the establishment. It shall be presumed that an
attendant knew a person was under the age of eighteen (18) unless such
attendant asked for and was furnished a valid drivers license issued by a state
reflecting that person's age.
130.11Â  DEVELOPMENT DESIGN STANDARDS.
1.Â Â Â Exterior. It is unlawful for an owner of an adult entertainment business:
Â Â Â A.Â Â Â To allow the merchandise or activities of the establishment to be
visible from any point outside the establishment.
Â Â Â B.Â Â Â To allow the exterior portion of the adult entertainment business to
have flashing lights, or any words, lettering, photographs, silhouettes,
drawings, or pictorial representation of any manner depicting specified
anatomical areas or specified sexual activities.Â 
Â Â Â C.Â Â Â To allow exterior portions of the establishment to be painted other
than a single color.
2.Â Â Â Signage.
Â Â Â A.Â Â Â Notwithstanding any other City ordinance, code or regulation to the
contrary, it is unlawful for the owner or operator of any sexually oriented
business or any other person to erect, construct, or maintain any sign for the
sexually oriented business other than the one primary sign and one secondary
sign, as provided herein.
Â Â Â B.Â Â Â Primary signs shall have no more than two (2) display surfaces.Â  Each
such display surface shall:
Â Â Â Â Â Â (1)Â Â Â Not contain any flashing lights;
Â Â Â Â Â Â (2)Â Â Â Be a flat plane, rectangular in shape;
Â Â Â Â Â Â (3)Â Â Â Not exceed 75 square feet in area; and
Â Â Â Â Â Â (4)Â Â Â Not exceed 10 feet in height or ten feet in length.
Â Â Â C.Â Â Â Primary signs shall contain no photographs, silhouettes, drawings or
pictorial representations in any manner, and may contain only the name of the
enterprise.
Â Â Â D.Â Â Â Each letter forming a word on a primary sign shall be of solid color
and each such letter shall be the same print-type, size and color.Â  The
background behind such lettering on the display surface of a primary sign shall
be of a uniform and solid color.
Â Â Â E.Â Â Â Secondary signs shall have only one display surface.Â  Such display
surface shall:
Â Â Â Â Â Â (1)Â Â Â Be a flat plane, rectangular in shape;
Â Â Â Â Â Â (2)Â Â Â Not exceed twenty (20) square feet in area;
Â Â Â Â Â Â (3)Â Â Â Not exceed five (5) feet in height and four (4) feet in width; and
Â Â Â Â Â Â (4)Â Â Â Be affixed or attached to any wall or door of the enterprise.
130.12Â  HOURS OF OPERATION.
An adult entertainment business may remain open for business no longer than the
hours from between 10:00 a.m. to midnight, seven days a week.
130.13Â  NUISANCE.
Any adult entertainment business operated, conducted or maintained contrary to
the provisions of the chapter shall be and the same is hereby declared to be
unlawful and a public nuisance, and the City Attorney may, in addition to or in
lieu of prosecuting a criminal action hereunder, commence an action or
proceeding for the abatement, removal or enjoinment thereof, in the manner
provided by law, and shall take such other steps and shall apply to such court
or courts as may have jurisdiction to grant such relief as will abate or remove
such establishment and restrain and enjoin any person from operating,
conducting or maintaining an adult entertainment business contrary to the
provisions of this chapter.
CHAPTER 135

135.01Â  REMOVAL OF WARNING DEVICES.
It is unlawful for a person to willfully remove, throw down, destroy or carry
away from any street or alley any lamp, obstruction, guard or other article or
things, or extinguish any lamp or other light, erected or placed thereupon for
the purpose of guarding or enclosing unsafe or dangerous places in said street
or alley without the consent of the person in control thereof.
(Code of Iowa, Sec. 716.1)
135.02Â  OBSTRUCTING OR DEFACING.
It is unlawful for any person to obstruct, deface, or injure any street or
alley in any manner.
(Code of Iowa, Sec. 716.1)
135.03Â  PLACING DEBRIS ON.
It is unlawful for any person to throw or deposit on any street or alley any
glass, glass bottle, nails, tacks, wire, cans, trash, garbage, rubbish, litter,
offal, leaves, weeds, grass, grass clippings, ashes from burning leaves, grass
or grass clippings or any other debris likely to be washed into the storm sewer
and clog the storm sewer or which may be washed into the lake and cause injury
to the lake, or any substance likely to injure any person, animal or vehicle.
(Code of Iowa, Sec. 321.369)
135.04Â  PLAYING IN.
It is unlawful for any person to coast, sled or play games on streets or
alleys, except in the areas blocked off by the City for such purposes.
(Code of Iowa, Sec. 364.12[2])
135.05Â  TRAVELING ON BARRICADED STREET OR ALLEY.
It is unlawful for any person to travel or operate any vehicle on any street or
alley temporarily closed by barricades, lights, signs, or flares placed thereon
by the authority or permission of any City official, police officer or member
of the fire department.
135.06Â  USE FOR BUSINESS PURPOSES.
It is unlawful to park, store or place, temporarily or permanently, any
machinery or junk or any other goods, wares, and merchandise of any kind upon
any street or alley for the purpose of storage, exhibition, sale or offering
same for sale, without permission of the Council.
135.07Â  WASHING VEHICLES.
It is unlawful for any person to use any public sidewalk, street or alley for
the purpose of washing or cleaning any automobile, truck equipment, or any
vehicle of any kind when such work is done for hire or as a business.Â  This
does not prevent any person from washing or cleaning his or her own vehicle or
equipment when it is lawfully parked in the street or alley.
135.08Â  BURNING PROHIBITED.
No person shall burn any trash, leaves, rubbish or other combustible material
in any curb and gutter or on any paved or surfaced street or alley.
135.09Â  EXCAVATIONS.
No person shall dig, excavate or in any manner disturb any street, parking or
alley except in accordance with the following:
1.Â Â Â Licensed Excavator or Plumber.Â  No person except a licensed excavator or
licensed plumber shall make any excavation in any street, parking or alley
within the City.Â  Provided, however, this subsection does not apply to City
employees, utility companies or persons acting under and by virtue of a
contract with the City.
2.Â Â Â Permit Required.Â  No excavation shall be commenced without first obtaining
a permit therefor.Â  A written application for such permit shall be filed with
the Public Works Director and shall contain the following:
Â Â Â A.Â Â Â An exact description of the property, by lot and street number, in
front of or along which it is desired to excavate;
Â Â Â B.Â Â Â A statement of the purpose, for whom and by whom the excavation is to
be made;
Â Â Â C.Â Â Â The person responsible for the refilling of said excavation and
restoration of the street or alley surface; and
Â Â Â D.Â Â Â Date of commencement of the work and estimated completion date.
3.Â Â Â Public Convenience.Â  Streets and alleys shall be opened in the manner
which will cause the least inconvenience to the public and admit the
uninterrupted passage of water along the gutter on the street.
4.Â Â Â Barricades, Fencing and Lighting.Â  Adequate barricades, fencing and
warning lights meeting standards specified by the City shall be so placed as to
protect the public from hazard.Â  Any costs incurred by the City in providing or
maintaining adequate barricades, fencing or warning lights shall be paid to the
City by the permit holder/property owner.
5.Â Â Â Restoration of Public Property.Â  Streets, sidewalks, alleys and other
public property disturbed in the course of the work shall be restored to the
condition of the property prior to the commencement of the work, or in a manner
satisfactory to the City, at the expense of the permit holder/property owner.
6.Â Â Â Inspection.Â  All work shall be subject to inspection by the City.Â 
Backfill shall not be deemed completed, nor resurfacing of any improved street
or alley surface begun, until such backfill is inspected and approved by the
City.Â  The permit holder/property owner shall provide the City with notice at
least twenty-four (24) hours prior to the time when inspection of backfill is
desired.
7.Â Â Â Completion by the City.Â  Should any excavation in any street or alley be
discontinued or left open and unfinished for a period of twenty-four (24) hours
after the approved completion date, or in the event the work is improperly
done, the City has the right to finish or correct the excavation work and
charge any expenses therefor to the permit holder/property owner.
8.Â Â Â Responsibility for Costs.Â  All costs and expenses incident to the
excavation shall be borne by the permit holder and/or property owner.Â  The
permit holder and owner shall indemnify the City from any loss or damage that
may directly or indirectly be occasioned by such excavation.
9.Â Â Â Notification.Â  At least forty-eight (48) hours prior to the commencement
of the excavation, excluding Saturdays, Sundays and legal holidays, the person
performing the excavation shall contact the Statewide Notification Center and
provide the center with the information required under Section 480.4 of the
Code of Iowa.
10.Â Â Â Permit Fee.Â  A permit fee of twenty dollars ($20.00) shall be payable at
the time of filing the application with the City.Â  A separate permit shall be
required for each excavation.
11.Â Â Â Permit Issued.Â  Upon approval of the application and payment of the
permit fee, a permit shall be issued.
12.Â Â Â Permit Exemption.Â  Utility companies are exempt from the permit fee
requirement of this section.Â  They shall, however, comply with all other
pertinent provisions and shall post with the City a yearly bond in the amount
of five thousand dollars ($5,000.00) to guarantee such compliance.
135.10Â  MAINTENANCE OF PARKING OR TERRACE.
It shall be the responsibility of the abutting property owner to maintain all
property outside the lot and property lines and inside the curb lines upon the
public streets, except that the abutting property owner shall not be required
to remove diseased trees or dead trees on the publicly owned property or right-
of-way. Maintenance includes timely mowing, trimming trees and shrubs and
picking up litter.
(Code of Iowa, Sec. 364.12[2c])
135.11Â  FAILURE TO MAINTAIN PARKING OR TERRACE.
If the abutting property owner does not perform an action required under the
above section within a reasonable time, the City may perform the required
action and assess the cost against the abutting property for collection in the
same manner as a property tax.
(Code of Iowa, Sec. 364.12[2e])
135.12Â  DUMPING OF SNOW.
It is unlawful for any person to throw, push, or place or cause to be thrown,
pushed or placed, any ice or snow from private property, sidewalks, or
driveways onto the traveled way of a street or alley so as to obstruct gutters,
or impede the passage of vehicles upon the street or alley or to create a
hazardous condition therein; except where, in the cleaning of large commercial
drives in the business district it is absolutely necessary to move the snow
onto the street or alley temporarily, such accumulation shall be removed
promptly by the property owner or agent.
Arrangements for the prompt removal of such accumulations shall be made prior
to moving the snow.
(Code of Iowa, Sec. 364.12 [2])
135.13Â  DRIVEWAY CULVERTS.
The property owner shall, at the ownerâ€™s expense, install any culvert deemed
necessary under any driveway or any other access to the ownerâ€™s property, and
before installing a culvert, permission must first be obtained from the City.Â 
In the event repairs are needed at any time with respect to culverts, it shall
be the responsibility of the property owner to make such repairs, and, in the
event the owner fails to do so, the City shall have the right to make the
repairs.Â  If the property owner fails to reimburse the City for the cost of
said repairs, the cost shall be certified to the County Treasurer and specially
assessed against the property as by law provided.
CHAPTER 136
SIDEWALK REGULATIONS
